moves.1. b3:
I illustrate this game to emphasise- never give up. 
On move 26  I lost a bishop due to sloppy playing. After that I concentrated on attacking his king by advancing a pawn right up and by getting my queen and 2 rooks over. Sure, a player of 1700 rating would have seen through it, but for some of us whose rating hovers between 1550 and 1600 will enjoy this game.
(More entertainment than education )
moves.7... Nd4 8. a3 Bxc3+ 9. Bxc3 Nxe2 10. Qx: his exchanges so far have not made much sense
moves.10... O-O 11. h3: I want to drive his bishop away
moves.11... Bxf3 12. Qxf3 c5 13. O-O b5 14. Bb: Unfortunately I wake up late to his pawn advance into my territory
moves.15. Qe3: I move my queen out of the way to advance the f pawn
moves.18... c4 19. d4 f6 20. Rg3 Rf7: bad strategy on my part- see my bishop locked in
moves.24... Rc8 25. b4: now it is getting messy for me
moves.25... Na4: knights are my weak point, I have lost my bishop
moves.26. Qd2 Nxb2 27. c3 Na4 28. h4: pawn advance starts and a plan is forming in my desperate brain- will it work
moves.30... Ra8: I have to be careful about his moves on the left flank
moves.31. h6: what will he do, this pawn must be beginning to annoy him
moves.31... Qe7: Not sure why he does that- now he feels a bit of pressure
moves.32. Rf1: rook comes over to join attack
moves.32... Ra3: he is putting pressure on my c pawn- I lose that, his pawn will become queen
attack on his king building up
moves.37... Na4 38. Qf3: I plan queen move to h5- have you spotted what that would do?
moves.38... Qa7 39. Qh5: if my q can get in on e8
moves.39... Nb2 40. hxg7: Too late for him- if he takes the pawn with his rook, my queen will move to e8 and mate him
moves.40... Kxg7 41. Qxh7+: only a matter of time now
moves.42. Qh8+: if he moves king to e7, my rooks will come to h7. He resigns. gctbob and I have had good games. This game shows never give up- sometimes you can cook up a strategy that the other wakes up to, too late. Hope you enjoyed this.
